newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: MBf Capital stock suspended - KLSE.
newsitem.headline: MBf Capital stock suspended - KLSE.

text.p: Trading in the stock of MBf Capital Bhd has been suspended from Monday for an announcement, an official at the Kuala Lumpur Stock Exchange said.
The stock was last traded on Friday at 5.20 ringgit.
Senior officials at MBf Capital, a financial services firm, were not immediately available for comment.
The company has since last month been rumoured to be targeting to take over Suria Capital Holdings Bhd, which owns Sabah Bank Bhd and Sabah Development Bank.
Last last month, MBf Capital's chief executive officer and president Loy Hean Heang told reporters the company has always been looking for a bank, but declined to confirm the Suria plan.
Suria has repeatedly denied that it was in talks with MBf.
The suspension of MBf on Monday boosted Suria's stock.
"I think there's possible news on the two," said a dealer at a Penang-based brokerage.
Around 0205 GMT, Suria was up 9.0 cents to 2.97 ringgit on the market's heaviest volume of 4.1 million.
